response.message: Thank you, Stack Exchange. You're all awesome.

This is incredible! Thank you Stack Exchange for not only making the Internet better, but also donating and giving back to those who would benefit from the financial support. This is incredible, thanks for all that is done, it makes us all proud to be a Stack Exchange contributor. Thanks again! You're all awesome. :D
I'm not familiar with the Ada Initiative but it sounds like an excellent cause. Thanks for introducing us!
I am a proud member of SE site. This is the most meaningful site on internet.
Agreed. Thank you SE Staff!
Thanks, this is awesome in its best. :-)
Very glad to see that I've made a real, tangible difference, of course on behalf of the awesome people at Stack Exchange :) Thanks for doing all the amazing things you do!
You guys are awesome!

Thank YOU guys!

For all your kindness and all your humanity..
Very cool.

Time spent on Stack Exchange == Time well spent.
You guys are awesome, and the donation to non-programming causes are very much appreciated!

This is exactly what Christmas should be about: giving and helping. It's what we should teach our children to do this time of year, instead of expecting gifts.

Thank you StackExchange for being a role-model among organizations/companies/whatever.

Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year !

jQuery?

*twitch*

As an avid speedrunning fan, I can only hope that the Doctors Without Borders donation was made during the Summer Games Done Quick 2014 Marathon (a charity speedrunning marathon that raised over $700k for DWB this past June).

If not, that's only *slightly* disappointing, though $15k for DWB is awesome.

StackExchange ('s community) surely gives back all year long, always a pleasure to be stuck on a coding problem and finding the answer on StackOverflow within a minute! (and return the favor to others when possible)
Keep up the good work.
Proud to be a member in StackExchange. Appreciate you.
Proud to be part of this community.

Hi,

Awesome post.This is a wonderfully  post on Stack Exchange. I enjoyed this article. I would love to see some more such interesting article from your side.

Thanks for writing and I hope that you’ll have a happy weekend.

Keep up your great work!

Regards, 
varija tripathi
MErci enormement pour les bonnes actions
poolxyzcaac-++-
Proud to be a member in StackExchange

I've only been a member for a few months, but have been welcomed and helped by members of the community and moderators. I'm blessed to be a part of this family and thank you for giving so generously to these charities. Through family and friends, I have first-hand knowledge of Doctors Without Borders, and know that they are worthy of your support. Thanks and God bless you.
Wow! I'm proud to have anything to do with this community! Hope we have a greater 2015. I sure will try being a part of Give back 2015
Why don't you also donate some money to my account ? That would really impress me

WHY just moderators? 

If moderators can help in this cause, then why not we (the actual users of this beautiful community). Is there a way that we can also donate a little bit? 

This is really amazing by you guys, Hats Off !!  :)

Happy New Year in well advance

Regards,
Hemang Shah
@Hemang No one is stopping you from donating to charity.  SE has millions of users, they can't possibly donate for each of them.
Wao that is a greatest gift I have seen someone giving it. Giving away 43000 USD to the charity is simply awesome. Sharing your story with others. Happy New year.
You're not only making the internet a better place ...

43,300$!

StackExchange is very generous! Very proud of being a member of SE.
good sharing
Thanks!! wishing you good luck for 2015.
You are adding some awesomeness to internet...keep going!!
No doubt, SE you are marvelous! Happy New Year and Let's hope next year will go like this only! Keep it up! :D
$43K spent on charities is a very good one. Good luck in 2015
